subsection_content:
Adults and children are both at risk of laryngitis. At different ages, risk factors will be different. Specifically:
For adults:
People who are often exposed to toxic chemicals and allergens; People with stomach acid reflux; People with repeated episodes of rhinosinusitis; People who regularly smoke or are near smokers; People who use their voice too much such as teachers, singers, MCs, businessmen, traders...; People get fungal infections because they often use asthma inhalers
For young children:
Children often have nasopharyngitis, then laryngitis; Children often scream or sing too much, causing swelling of the vocal cords
